Text.Value: And replace it with another. Don't ask me to kill my parents, please. I can't live with that.

Text.Value: Do what's right. I think I lost sight of that some time ago. Better to just serve blindly.

Text.Value: I am neither. I am nothing. I am the empty room. The dreamless sleep. The shadow's shadow.

Text.Value: You're no burden. You're my strength. I think I know where my wilful side comes from now.
What about your memories? Isn't there more that was taken from you?
I knew the dark woods wouldn't frighten you. You were always such a brave girl.
I... I hurt you both. So much. Gods forgive me...

EditorData.NodeContext: Distraught/shamed. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: Free, but with the memory of what I've done. Don't ask me to kill my parents, please. I can't live with that.

EditorData.NodeContext: pleading. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: You were meant to be a guiding light for SelÃ»ne's faithful, but they robbed you from us. Now that can be righted, and we can rest.

EditorData.NodeContext: (SelÃ»ne = seh-LOO-nuh)

Text.Value: Finish this. End their suffering.
She's gone... I don't understand.

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: You cannot. We are still bound to you. You cannot both free us and free yourself from her curse.

Text.Value: Enough. I'm taking my parents away from here. I'm taking them away from you.

... the glow fades. Shadowheart's parents are gone. In their place are two floating motes of light. They dance gently in the air before Shadowheart. She smiles at them.

Text.Value: We never stopped. Thank you, Moonmaiden. You let me see my Jenevelle, my baby girl, one last time.
You learned so much, applying your skills to these two. Now you can remember it all, whenever you look upon their faces.

Text.Value: You can endure it together, as a family. This is what you've been looking for - don't deny yourself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud, triumphant. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: This is your choice, Shadowheart. You don't need me to tell you what is right.

Text.Value: Kill them, for me. Then I will take the memories away from you again. Loss will heal you, and you will be my right hand, at last.

Text.Value: There was no pain before my sister set the sun aflame. Now you exist to suffer, until you find your way back to my embrace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: And you did. You found us.
The Dark Lady offers you a rare kindness. Give the prisoners a merciful death. End your pain.
My name is Shadowheart.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Chris] *REUSE* [SH Parents] Reuse from AOM_OOM version of this scene
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH's power flares wildly, engulfing the pair. Their Sharran disc restraints vanish and they collapse to the floor, dead. Shadowheart drops to her knees, in shock.
EditorData.NodeContext: Anger/emotion blowing over. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: It's not her, Emm. It's just another trick. Another way to hurt us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to rally his wife's nerves

Text.Value: You forced Lady Shar's hand and paid the price. I hope your freedom is worth it.

*You find yourself thrust into Shadowheart's mind, but it's different than before. There's more. More than you - or she - can comprehend. A flood of restored memories, finished thoughts, revealed secrets...*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A surge of darkness overtakes the player. The tadpole jolts, assailing them with psionic power. The darkness consumes them.

Text.Value: Moon motes. They bring SelÃ»ne's light to dark places and offer guidance to those in need.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH looks at the surrounding moon motes dancing around
EditorData.NodeContext: (SelÃ»ne = seh-LOO-nuh) At peace after giving her parents the death they asked for. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: What's right... Have I ever known what that truly is?

EditorData.NodeContext: Pensive/conflicted. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: You see? It matters not if you raze this place, if you slay every one of your brothers and sisters. That was never where my power resided.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar's silhouette melts away and the dark Shadowfell aura fades. The room is as it was before.

Text.Value: This was my gift to you. Power is not created; it merely changes from one form to another. Their pain becomes your might. Their suffering furthers your glory.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shar lowers the sword arm (right arm) out of view and gazes intently down at SH and co. Left arm still appears to be holding them up.
EditorData.NodeContext: Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: Not goodbye. Not even close.
Shar will never admit defeat - not until she has stolen one last thing from you. We cannot allow your future to be her last prize - not after all your mother and I have endured to see you again.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere.

Text.Value: Gladly.
It is not over.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony on their disc-restaints. Finally it abates and Shadowheart stands
EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: Their wrongheaded resolve allowed me to shape you. But I need not tell you - I can show you. It is time to remember. Time to remember everything.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: Leave? You should never have come. You should have hidden away forever.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold, imperious (Shadowheart is out of favour with Shar). Shar pose -starts with left hand underneath the floor as if holding up SH and co on a platter, right hand angling the tip of a sword towards SH and co, elbow back and head slightly tilted to her left. Then lowers the sword arm to her side (out of view for player) and stands looming over SH and co, left hand still appearing to hold them up.

Text.Value: The price of insubordination. You could have been blissfully ignorant if you stayed in my embrace. But you strayed. And now you choose.
They're your parents. They'll forgive you.

EditorData.stateContext: Huge visage of Shar present, looming over SH, her parents and the player. Dark, swirling Shadowfell atmosphere. Shar has sword arm (right arm) lowered out of sight, and left hand appearing to be holding the platform on which SH and co are standing. Shar is gazing down at them.

Text.Value: Sacrifices. My final test, whoever they are. A rather meagre offering to the Dark Lady... but it is not my place to question her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: *Shar's parting words make your flesh crawl. There is no lesson to be learned here - only a family's torment, a spiteful goddess' whims, and an unspeakable choice to be made...*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Chris] *RUSUE* [SH] Reuse from AOM_OOM version of this scene
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A dark aura pulses from the black mirror, casting shadows throughout the chamber. Shadowheart doubles over in pain as her incurable wound flares intensely. Her parents also writhe in agony. Finally it abates and Shadowheart straightens - to see a vast silhouette of Shar leaning over her and her parents. Shar's features cannot be clearly seen, but her words reverberate through SH's head.

Text.Value: Yes. It was worth it. No words of yours can diminish that.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SH smiles at the motes (while the line is directed at the player)
EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant - she's cut ties with Shar forever. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: There is nothing to forgive. You did what was necessary. To survive.
It's time we left. We're not finished with the Absolute just yet. Only now, Shar's forces are mine to command, when the battle comes.

EditorData.NodeContext: Full of resolve. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: They are with the Moonmaiden now.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Chris] *REUSE [SH] Reuse from AOM_OOM version of this scene
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart's hand begins to glow with SelÃ»nite power. It intensifies, engulfing her and her parents. The player turns away... the glow fades. The sharran discs have vanished. SH's parents are now free of their restraints, weak on their feet. Shadowheart embraces them gently.

Text.Value: We'll still be with you. By the Moonmaiden's grace, we'll never be far. Please, Jenevelle.
They're... they're my parents.

EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet shock. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: Don't call me that. My name is Shadowheart.

EditorData.NodeContext: Conflicted/clinging to her SH identity. Path 1: Shadowheart comes to this scene as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddessâ€™s command. She's found herself being commanded to sacrifice her long-lost parents.

Text.Value: It can't be. Another vile trick...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart approaches two upright discs upon which an elf man and human woman are restrained to each. (This should be reminiscent of the figure SH glimpsed in Shar's symbol during her vision after killing Nightsong). The elf man lifts his head to see Shadowheart and reacts with disbelief. His disc flares. He breaks off with a cry of pain.

EditorData.stateContext:
Shadowheart and her parents in Grotto

Parents are bound to breaking wheels/discs evoking Shar

Text.Value: I don't know where home is anymore... but it's not here.

Text.Value: I'm... I'm sorry. I didn't know any of this was happening until it was much too late. I came to try put things right.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ashamed/contrite. Talking to her parents. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: Our time has passed, Jenevelle. You must not let us burden you.
You are just lost, Jenevelle. SelÃ»ne will show you the way home, in time -

Text.Value: But I only just found you again, after all this time. I can't lose you again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Rising emotion/upset. Path 2: Shadowheart comes to this scene as someone who has turned from Shar and is seeking to rescue her parents - only Shar remains spiteful and is intent on tainting the reunion with a terrible dilemma.

Text.Value: Do you remember your training, child? I know you do.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold and imperious. Soothing tone has wilted away. Shar pose: right arm at her side (previously seen holding a sword - still in hand but no longer in view. Left hand extended underneath the platform on which SH an co stand, as if holding them in her palm/on a platter before her. Speaking down to them.

Text.Value: What are those?
I have to do it. My whole life has been leading to this.

Text.Value: We, child. We did this to them together. My power, and your will.

EditorData.NodeContext: All-poweful, yet motherly, soothing, supportive - SH has been her loyal follower up to this point, and Shar wishes her to make a final sacrifice. Synopsis:
Shadowheart meets with her parents once again, who have been imprisoned for decades. A vision of Shar appears and demands Shadowheart sacrifice her parents.
Note: there are two major tracks in this scene - if SH comes to it as a loyal Sharran who is intent on taking control of the church at her goddess's command, or as someone who has turned from Shar and is coming to rescue her parents.
